question: What is the name of India’s first indigenous physiological parameter monitoring system for COVID-19 patients?
explanation:
Union Minister Jitendra Singh has recently launched India’s first indigenous physiological parameter monitoring system for COVID-19 patients named COVID BEEP.
The COVID BEEP (Continuous Oxygenation & Vital Information Detection Biomed ECIL ESIC Pod) system has been developed by ESIC Medical College Hyderabad in collaboration with IIT Hyderabad and Department of Atomic Energy. The latest version of COVID BEEP has also been fixed with the ECG monitor.
